full_summary:
# Psychological Risk Assessment Services Tender

## Details

### Solicitation Number: 21220-24-4603150
### Publication Date: 2023-12-22
### Tender Closing Date: 2024-02-12T13:00:00
### Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-04-01
### Expected Contract End Date: 2027-03-31

## Description

The Correctional Service of Canada, Atlantic Region, is soliciting services for a psychological risk assessment for offenders housed at the Dorchester Complex. The contract is for a period of one year with two optional extension periods of one year each.

## Objectives

The Contractor will provide psychological risk assessment services to offenders, as requested by the Project Authority, at Dorchester Complex as a psychologist. The Contractor must take into account gender, cultural, religious, and linguistic differences and be responsive to the special needs of women and Indigenous people.

## Deliverables

The Contractor must provide all services in compliance with federal and provincial legislation, national guidelines, practice standards, and Correctional Service of Canada Policy/Guidelines. The Contractor must provide a comprehensive psychological risk assessment report that includes the following:

* Demographic information
* Reason for referral
* Interview information
* Documentation reviewed
* Brief criminal history
* Institutional and community adjustment
* Brief psychosocial/relevant history
* Interview impressions/mental health
* Summary of previous assessments
* Cognitive functioning and personality
* Treatment needs/responsivity
* Assessment of risk, risk management strategies, and recommendations

## Contract Terms

* Period of the Contract: 1 April 2024 - 31 March 2025 with option to renew for two additional one-year periods.
* Contracting Authority: Sylvie Gallant
* Telephone number: 506-378-8724
* E-mail: Sylvie.Gallant@csc-scc.gc.ca

## Note to Bidders

Bidders can obtain the complete statement of work and evaluation criteria by downloading the solicitation document and associated documents from the Canada buys/tender opportunities website. The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French). After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.

## Contact Information

Sylvie Gallant, Contracting Authority
Phone: 506-378-8724
Email: [Sylvie.Gallant@csc-s
